segment.source: While planning your deployment of the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT), consider which computers you want running the various tools, packages, and services for ACT.
segment.target: While planning your deployment of the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT), consider which computers you want running the various tools, packages, and services for ACT.

segment.source: While planning your deployment of the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT), consider which computers you want running the various tools, packages, and services for ACT.
segment.target: While planning your deployment of the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT), consider which computers you want running the various tools, packages, and services for ACT.

segment.source: The following diagram shows supported deployment options for an ACT installation.
segment.target: The following diagram shows supported deployment options for an ACT installation.

segment.source: The options listed first are the most highly recommended.
segment.target: The options listed first are the most highly recommended.

segment.source: If you plan to deploy inventory-collector packages to computers running Windows XP, where some of the computers are on a different domain than the ACT LPS share, do one of the following:
segment.target: If you plan to deploy inventory-collector packages to computers running Windows XP, where some of the computers are on a different domain than the ACT LPS share, do one of the following:

segment.source: Set up a separate ACT LPS share on each domain and configure the inventory-collector package to upload log files to the ACT LPS share on the same domain.
segment.target: Set up a separate ACT LPS share on each domain and configure the inventory-collector package to upload log files to the ACT LPS share on the same domain.

segment.source: Set up a single ACT LPS share on one computer.
segment.target: Set up a single ACT LPS share on one computer.

segment.source: On the computer that hosts the share, use Group Policy to allow connections from anonymous users.
segment.target: On the computer that hosts the share, use Group Policy to allow connections from anonymous users.

segment.source: These steps are not necessary if the computers where you deploy inventory-collector packages are running Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, or Windows 10.
segment.target: These steps are not necessary if the computers where you deploy inventory-collector packages are running Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, or Windows 10.

segment.source: If you choose to have distributed logging with a subsequent step of moving log files to your central share, move the files to the central share before processing the files.
segment.target: If you choose to have distributed logging with a subsequent step of moving log files to your central share, move the files to the central share before processing the files.

segment.source: You can move the files manually or use a technology like Distributed File-System Replication (DFSR).
segment.target: You can move the files manually or use a technology like Distributed File-System Replication (DFSR).
